items.title: Mexico Natural Gas Imports Ticking Upward as U.S. Prices Weaken
items.summary: Daily nominations for U.S. natural gas pipeline flows to Mexico hit their second-highest level of February to date on Tuesday amid subdued physical and futures market pricing in the United States.

items.title: Global Gas Prices Ease as Europe Warms Briefly, Asian LNG Imports Slip
items.summary: Global natural gas futures shifted to reset mode as European gas traders used a brief weather reprieve to weigh forecasts and Asian demand continued to ebb.

items.title: LNG Buyers Seek Short-Term Deals, Caps on Volumes From Single Sellers in Push to Diversify Supplies
items.summary: Global buyers plan to continue signing contracts for additional LNG volumes in the coming years, with more of them aiming for short-term deals as they work to diversify supplies and enhance flexibility after energy flows were upended by the war in Uk

items.title: Futures Settle: Warming Outlook Cools Supply Fears, Caps Upside in Natural Gas Futures
items.summary: Natural gas futures were capped Tuesday as traders looked past recent cold, with spring-like forecasts, declining demand and healthy production reinforcing confidence in an ample end-of-season supply.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Vary Amid Mixed Fundamentals
items.summary: After steep and widespread losses to start the week, spot gas prices leveled off to a degree at midday Tuesday amid mild near-term temperatures but hints of late February cold and elevated export activity.

items.title: Winter’s Cold Turn Vaults EIA’s 2026 Natural Gas Price Outlook up 23%
items.summary: Winter Storm Fern in late January dramatically reshaped the outlook for U.S. natural gas prices, driving record demand that erased a winter storage surplus and prompted federal forecasters to sharply raise their price projections for this year.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Prices Find Fragile Footing
items.summary: Natural gas futures held in positive territory at around noon on Tuesday as bargain buyers stepped back into the market following a steep loss on Monday and a pullback last week.

items.title: Midwest Natural Gas Storage Deep in Deficit Territory
items.summary: Natural gas stowed in Midwest storage fell far short of historical norms amid the late-January cold front that froze the region.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Physical Natural Gas Fizzling as Weather Weakens
items.summary: After reaching dizzying heights at the peak of Winter Storm Fern in late January, physical natural gas prices have come crashing down to pre-storm levels amid loosening supply/demand fundamentals.

items.title: China’s Clean Energy Boom Still Rests on Coal, Oil, and Gas
items.summary: Over the past decade, China’s renewable energy and related clean technologies have emerged as the fastest-growing sectors of the economy, significantly outpacing the overall economy. Last year, China’s clean energy investments hit a record 7.2 trilli

items.title: Electricity Demand Is Surging—The Grid Isn’t Ready
items.summary: Global electricity demand is rising at the fastest pace in 15 years and will continue to do so at least until the end of the decade as AI infrastructure, advanced manufacturing, and electrification have ushered in The Age of Electricity, the Internat

items.title: US Crude Oil Inventory Build Pressures Prices
items.summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States increased by a whopping 13.4 million barrels in the week ending February 6, and more than offsetting the prior week’s draw of 11.1 million barrels. Inven

items.title: German Oil Refinery Sounds Alarm Over U.S. Sanctions Risk
items.summary: Germany’s uneasy energy truce with Washington is starting to fray, and the pressure point is a single refinery that keeps Berlin moving. Managers at the PCK Schwedt refinery, majority-owned by Russia’s Rosneft (54.17%), have privately warned the Germ

items.title: Five Scenarios for Iran and What They Would Mean for Oil Markets
items.summary: To help navigate the uncertainty, we have framed five possible scenarios, detailed below, that outline plausible pathways, from diplomatic normalization to severe destabilization, and assess their consequences for geopolitics and global oil markets.

items.title: As U.S. Drilling Cools, Oilfield Service Firms Chase Middle East Demand
items.summary: The U.S. shale revolution is widely considered one of the most significant energy, economic, and industrial transformations in American history. By combining horizontal drilling and hydraulic fracturing (fracking) to unlock massive oil and gas reserv
